action_title: Crassula helmsii: Use lightproof barriers to control plants
key_messages:
Key Messages:

Five before-and-after studies in the UKÂ found that covering Crassula helmsii with black sheeting or carpet strips eradicated or severely reduced the cover of the plant. However, C. helmsii was reported to have progressively recolonized two of the sites where it had been had initially been reported as eradicated.
background_information:
Background information and definitions:
Covering vegetation with lightproof barriers, such as matting or black sheeting, can control growth and eventually kill plants by preventing photosynthesis.
